content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
• Common Input Chest (Wooden Chest) at (2.5, 0.5)
• New Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
• Sink Chest (Wooden Chest) at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Sink Inserter (Burner Inserter) at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5) with updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on automation in progress)
• Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles (ElectricityGroup id=1281) connecting the lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (status: NO_FUEL; fuel insertion incomplete) with a designated steam output point near (6.5, 20.5)
• Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam Engine at (19.5, 14.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings include “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
 – Steam Engine at (13.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
 – Steam Engine at (11.5, 20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
• Multiple PipeGroups managing the fluid system for power generation
• Note: Recent execution steps (steps 360–367) document several attempts to reposition or add a Steam Engine near the Boiler. Candidate placements at coordinates such as (4.5, 23.0), (10.0, 16.0), (6.0, 20.5), (11.0, 22.0) and (8.0, 17.0) were tested but failed due to placement constraints. In addition, an attempt to connect the existing Steam Engine at (11.5, 20.5) to the Boiler using pipes failed because of connection/obstruction issues, and a placement attempt via a nearest‐buildable area (targeting (13.0, 14.0)) was aborted due to the absence of a steam engine item in inventory.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Candidate Placement Verification:
 – Repeated “can_place_entity returned False” errors occurred for multiple candidate coordinates (e.g. (4.5, 23.0), (10.0, 16.0), (6.0, 20.5), (11.0, 22.0), (8.0, 17.0)).
  • Tip: Prior to placement, verify that candidate coordinates fall within a confirmed buildable area. Adjust BuildingBox dimensions, offsets, and environmental clearances as necessary.

• Pipe Connection Alignment:
 – The attempt to connect the Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) with the Steam Engine at (11.5, 20.5) failed with an error indicating obstruction or misalignment.
  • Tip: Reassess the alignment of connection points and ensure that intervening obstacles are cleared. Confirm that endpoints for pipe connections are correctly positioned for successful integration.

• Inventory Verification:
 – A steam engine placement attempt was aborted with an error stating “No steam_engine in inventory.”
  • Tip: Validate inventory contents before executing placement actions to ensure that required items are available.

• Consolidated Pre-Placement Checks:
 – Multiple placement errors suggest insufficient pre-action verification.
  • Tip: Use available API functions (such as can_place_entity and nearest_buildable) to confirm both viability and accessibility of candidate positions, and review environmental conditions to avoid recurrent placement failures.
